cohere_generated_answer: The factors that influence the speed and direction of wind are frictional force, the rotation of the Earth (Coriolis effect), and pressure variations. Frictional force is greatest at the surface and affects wind speed, while the Coriolis effect, caused by the Earth's rotation, influences the direction of wind, deflecting it right in the northern hemisphere and left in the southern hemisphere. Pressure variations cause air to move from high-pressure areas to low-pressure areas, and pressure gradients impact wind speed and direction.
